subject: [glotpress] User management, localization, plugins
body:
Greetings, Nikolay!
1. I translates glotpress via itselft, but i cant localize it.
Uploading PO/MOs into language has not effect.
2. I cant register new users, make free registration and define validators.
3. Where are plugins API reference or sample?
How I can do that all?
Thanks,
Sol.

replies.subject: [glotpress] User management, localization, plugins
replies.body:
On Mon, Mar 1, 2010 at 09:28, Sultan Salpagarov <salpagarov at gmail.com> wrote:
> Greetings, Nikolay!
>
> 1. I translates glotpress via itselft, but i cant localize it.
> Uploading PO/MOs into language has not effect.
>
> 2. I cant register new users, make free registration and define validators.
>
I use WordPress for user management :-)
You can add/remove validators from bottom of translation page -> Permissions
> 3. Where are plugins API reference or sample?
>
No API for now. It is just at a proof-of-concept phase.
Plugins work much as WordPress plugins. Put a php file at the plugins
dir and it will be loaded automatically. Use add_filter() and
add_action().
There is a base GP_Plugin class, which you might want to extend at
gp-includes/plugin.php but its interface is very likely to change
soon.
I will add a sample plugin to the repo at some point.
Happy hacking,
Nikolay.

subject: [glotpress] Export Translations doesn't work
body:
Hello,
I'm new in the glotpress world but I couldn't find any place with an answer
to my question.
I have GlotPress installed locally and works great, the problem is when
comes to install it in a hosting platform. I've tried in 5 different places
and everything works fine but just when I click the button export just says:
Not found (for the  url
translate/projects/oc/es/es/export-translations?format=po)
I would love to make this soft work for Open Classifieds, please any advice,
link or documentation, is more than welcome.
Thanks in advance.
-- 
Saludos / Regards, Chema
Barcelona, Spain GMT +1
http://garridodiaz.com
http://neo22s.com
http://deambulando.com
http://open-classifieds.com

It works for me on all installs I have. Both local and production.
Before debugging more, have you updated to the latest svn version?
Also, does the link without /export-translations work correctly:
translate/projects/oc/es/es ?
Happy translating,
Nikolay.

subject: [glotpress] Suggestions and a possible bug
body:
Hi Nikolay,
I've been using GlotPress at translate.wordpress.org and it's very good!
Good job!
But I'd like to suggest you some things:
1. The Breadcrumb next to the GlotPress title is quite confusing. When on a
page with strings to translate, it doesn't show the whole project title. I
think it's a problem, when for example I have more than one browser tab
opened with two different glotpress projects. I was translating both
BuddyPress and WordPress and as both tabs were displaying the title:
GlotPress > Development (trunk) I was confused which one was WP and which
one was BP. I know, maybe it's a rare situation, but it happens and I think
it would be better to have the whole project title displayed.
What do you think?
2. Display the number of all/untranslated/waiting/fuzzy/warning strings next
to those links. I'ts good to know how many strings you still need to work
on.
3. The tab index when showing the string details. When you click on
"details", the next tab is the "Add translation" button, but I think it
should be the "Copy from original" link, next "Translate from Google", next
the file reference, and only then the button.
4. Add the approve/reject buttons to the string details view, like we have
on the bulk edit.
Besides that, sometimes there seems to be a sort of a bug. Sometimes a
string I've just added keeps repeating, instead of jumping to the next one.
Another friend who's helping translate WP also experienced this bug. When we
refresh the page it seems to go away, but it's kind of annoying, because you
don't know if the string was approved/translated or not.
That's it by now, thanks for GlotPress!
Cheers
-- 
C?tia Kitahara
www.catiakitahara.com.br
www.wp-brasil.org
-------------- next part --------------
An HTML attachment was scrubbed...
URL: <http://lists.automattic.com/pipermail/glotpress/attachments/20100421/86e84a91/attachment.htm>

replies.subject: [glotpress] Suggestions and a possible bug
replies.body:
On Thu, Apr 22, 2010 at 02:19, C?tia Kitahara
<contato at catiakitahara.com.br> wrote:
> Hi Nikolay,
>
> I've been using GlotPress at translate.wordpress.org and it's very good!
> Good job!
> But I'd like to suggest you some things:
>
> 1. The Breadcrumb next to the GlotPress title is quite confusing. When on a
> page with strings to translate, it doesn't show the whole project title. I
> think it's a problem, when for example I have more than one browser tab
> opened with two different glotpress projects. I was translating both
> BuddyPress and WordPress and as both tabs were displaying the title:
> GlotPress > Development (trunk) I was confused which one was WP and which
> one was BP. I know, maybe it's a rare situation, but it happens and I think
> it would be better to have the whole project title displayed.
> What do you think?
>
This is a known bug, but needs a little more work and I keep
postponing it, because of more important things.
You can track the progress here: http://trac.glotpress.org/ticket/83
> 2. Display the number of all/untranslated/waiting/fuzzy/warning strings next
> to those links. I'ts good to know how many strings you still need to work
> on.
>
Yes
> 3. The tab index when showing the string details. When you click on
> "details", the next tab is the "Add translation" button, but I think it
> should be the "Copy from original" link, next "Translate from Google", next
> the file reference, and only then the button.
I modeled the tab stops after my behaviour?I rarely use Copy from
original and Google Translate. When I need them, it's ok for me to
grab the mouse and click on the link.
If most of you use these two links often, just tell me, we can put
them back in the tab order.
>
> 4. Add the approve/reject buttons to the string details view, like we have
> on the bulk edit.
>
There is a ticket for that: http://trac.glotpress.org/ticket/30
I, myself, rarely approve strings and didn't have much urge to
implement it. You can blame Z? for not  bugging me enough :-)
> Besides that, sometimes there seems to be a sort of a bug. Sometimes a
> string I've just added keeps repeating, instead of jumping to the next one.
> Another friend who's helping translate WP also experienced this bug. When we
> refresh the page it seems to go away, but it's kind of annoying, because you
> don't know if the string was approved/translated or not.
>
Yes, this is very annoying and this will be the first thing I will fix.
Thank you very much for giving GlotPress a chance.
Happy translating,
Nikolay.

subject: [glotpress] how to contribute?
body:
Hi,
i just take knowledge about this project, i entered to the irc with the hope
to talk with someone but no success :P
i want to contribute, i have more than 4 years in experience in
php/js/mysql, i already downloaded the source from the svn, but i don't know
how to use trac (to fix the bug) or if needed to develop more features.
waiting answer to work with all of you :)
Regards,
Shadow.
-------------- next part --------------
An HTML attachment was scrubbed...
URL: <http://lists.automattic.com/pipermail/glotpress/attachments/20100603/313e51be/attachment.htm>

replies.subject: [glotpress] how to contribute?
replies.body:
On Fri, Jun 4, 2010 at 05:01, david rene comba lareu
<shadow.of.soul08 at gmail.com> wrote:
> Hi,
>
Hey David,
> i just take knowledge about this project, i entered to the irc with the hope
> to talk with someone but no success :P
>
> i want to contribute, i have more than 4 years in experience in
> php/js/mysql, i already downloaded the source from the svn, but i don't know
> how to use trac (to fix the bug) or if needed to develop more features.
You don't need trac to fix bugs! You need trac just to share your
solution with us.
The process is simple:
0. Log in in trac. If you don't have a wordpress.org forums account,
registration takes a minute: http://wordpress.org/support/register.php
1. Add a ticket: http://trac.glotpress.org/newticket
Include what happens, what did you expect to happen and a pissble fix.
2. You can attach a patch, with your solution. Just run a `svn diff`
ion your checkout and give us the result.
That's all!
Welcome and happy hacking,
Nikolay

replies.subject: [glotpress] How to integrate it with WordPress
replies.body:
On Fri, Jun 4, 2010 at 21:40, C?tia Kitahara
<contato at catiakitahara.com.br> wrote:
> Hi Nikolay,
>
> We've installed GlotPress in our site to start translating plugins/themes
> But we'd like to share the same table of users as our WordPress
> installation, how is that possible? Could you please help us?
I added sample values and a comment in gp-config-sample.php:
http://trac.glotpress.org/browser/trunk/gp-config-sample.php?rev=503#L46
As the comment says before using the custom tables you should delete
your current permissions and then use the command line script to add
admins. The rest you can do via the web interface.
Happy translating,
Nikolay

subject: [glotpress] How do developers communicate for GlotPress and some
body:
other questions
Hi,
As somebody who likes to help out with the development of GlotPress I
have a few questions.
1. Is this list the best way to communicate with other developers, if
not what would be :)
I'm going to assume this is the best way as I can't create new posts on
the blog.
2. Is there a a place to see coding standards or there is no coding
standard (yet)?
On a side note, I created a git repository on github for glotpress. It
includes the external svn repo's as submodules. You can find it at
https://github.com/petervanderdoes/glotpress
I shall try to keep this updated with the SVN repo.
-- 
Peter van der Does

Cheers,

subject: [glotpress] New to list and some questions.
body:
I know the list is kind of dead, I mean according to the archive the
last email was send 6 months ago, but it is worth a shot to try here.
My name is Peter van der Does, I have written a couple of WordPress
plugins and thanks to some recent publicity, WordPress and Joost both
using GlotPress, I found this project and want to use it for my own
translations, not just for my WordPress plugins but I can use it for
other software as well.
Unfortunately it seems the project is at a stand still. Besides some
changes to the local.php the last "program" update was nearly 2 months
ago. There are several tickets in Trac with patches that have not been
acted upon.
So my question is, what is the status of the project?
I ran into a bug myself yesterday, I wanted to update the originals
and doing so made something like a 130 original strings obsolete,
running another import and the obsolete went down to about 30, and if I
kept importing it kept switching between 130 and 30 obsolete
strings, and just so you know these obsolete strings weren't suppose
to be obsolete as they existed in the original .po file.
So I wrote a patch for this, I still need to test some but it seems to
work. If the project is still active I will submit a ticket and attach
the patch.
If the development is at a stand still, or just dead, I might consider
the option of willing to taking over the project and revitalize it.
Regards,
Peter
-- 
Peter van der Does
GPG key: CB317D6E
IRC: Ganseki on irc.freenode.net
Twitter: @petervanderdoes
WordPress Plugin Developer
Blog: http://blog.avirtualhome.com
Forums: http://forums.avirtualhome.com
Twitter: @avhsoftware

subject: [glotpress] Suggestion
body:
I'm testing glotpress for wordpress-it.it to create a collaborative
platform for translations of themes, plugins and, wordpress & C.
I made a WP installation using the users and usermeta table of
glotpress, so I can have user registration with wordpress.
As a translation platform I need to create pages to explain how the
translation must be done and I have to create pages for each single
project and then I need a forum to discuss translation problem and
WordPress is fantastic for all these things.
So IMVHO I think that glotpress can become a very good plugin for wordpress.
What you think about that?
ciao
wolly

subject: [glotpress] GlotPress
body:
Hi Guys,
Thought I'd introduce myself to the group. My name is Jeffry G, I'm a  
developer working on the Wp-e-Commerce Plugin. We have GlotPress  
working nicely with WordPress (moved DB and using WordPress users  
table) was easy as pie, liked it a lot.
We've been trying to customize the look and feel of the templates, so  
been hacking away at the interface a bit, but then noticed the version  
we are running does not have some of the new and cool features (google  
translate especially) so thinking of doing an upgrade...
I was just wondering:
1. What is upgrading like with this software?
2. Is there any documentation around that? oh and documentation on  
actually using the software?
I had a look at the two php auto documentation sites they are great  
for devs but not really so informative for end users.
I understand the project is fairly new, but think it would be great to  
get some end user documentation together (even a basic readme) . So  
more people can get their heads around the system. That way you won't  
be hastled by people like me trying to use the software and you can  
spend more time making the system run like the wind~
Anyway look forward to hearing from yas.
best
jeff

replies.subject: [glotpress] GlotPress
replies.body:
On Thu, Feb 25, 2010 at 05:12, Jeffry Ghazally <jghazally at gmail.com> wrote:
> Hi Guys,
> Thought I'd introduce myself to the group. My name is Jeffry G, I'm a
> developer working on the Wp-e-Commerce Plugin. We have GlotPress working
> nicely with WordPress (moved DB and using WordPress users table) was easy as
> pie, liked it a lot.
> We've been trying to customize the look and feel of the templates, so been
> hacking away at the interface a bit, but then noticed the version we are
> running does not have some of the new and cool features (google translate
> especially) so thinking of doing an upgrade...
>
> I was just wondering:
> 1. What is upgrading like with this software?
Currently, you can visit install.php?action=upgrade to upgrade your
database. Upgrading the code is just a svn up.
> 2. Is there any documentation around that? oh and documentation on actually
> using the software?
>
Nope. Until now most of the users have been comfortable with digging
up stuff in the code.
I added a simple README:
http://trac.glotpress.org/browser/trunk/README
> I had a look at the two php auto documentation sites they are great for devs
> but not really so informative for end users.
> I understand the project is fairly new, but think it would be great to get
> some end user documentation together (even a basic readme) . So more people
> can get their heads around the system. That way you won't be hastled by
> people like me trying to use the software and you can spend more time making
> the system run like the wind~
>
Getting people who have questions to sign up to the list and ask them
here is not such bad idea ;-) At least we will know each other.
Happy hacking,
Nikolay.
